title: [K-12] Persuasive Game Design and Implementation for Healthy Living

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and general understanding of health management
context.additional_context: Learners engage in online (game platform) activities twice weekly and offline (workshop) activities once weekly, conducting team-based projects.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three core design principles of persuasive games (e.g., reward systems, challenge tasks).
Learners can collaboratively design a simple game prototype with their team that induces real-world health behavior changes (e.g., 30-minute daily exercise).
Learners can measure educational effectiveness using game-based learning assessment tools (e.g., engagement metrics, behavior change surveys).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
